Phono-semantic compound ( 形聲 / 形声 , OC *rlaː ): semantic 艹 + phonetic 余 ( OC *la ) .
茶 , then slightly modified into a more conservative 茶, originates as a graphical modification of archaic 荼 ( *rlaː , “ bitter plant ” ) , used for “tea” in classical sources. The modern version is unrelated to the bottom component of 條 .
